titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding aid for
George E. Pepin Papers, 1918-1919
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Olga Virakhovskaya

did.abstract: Typescript of diary of Pepin's military service.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Cathy Pepin-Toussaint, of Bloomfield, New Jersey, in 2008 (Donor no.: 9990).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder title, George E. Pepin Papers 1918-1919, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: George E. Pepin served in Co. B, 310th Engineers during the American intervention in North Russia. Pepin enlisted at Camp Custer, Mich., on July 3, 1918. His unit departed from the United States for Russia on July 21, 1918. Pepin returned to the United States on August 3, 1919, and was discharged at Camp Sherman, Ohio, August 13, 1919.

scopecontent.p: Typescript of diary of Pepin's military service; also Russian postcards and photographs of Pepin.
